p.s: Description of Nitrobacter hamburgensis sp. nov.
Nitrobacter hamburgensis (ham'bur.gensis. L. adj. of Hamburg, named after the place were this organism was first isolated)
Cells are Gram-negative, pleomorphic, rod to pear-shaped with a size of 0.5-0.8 x 1.0-2 μm.
Reproduction by binary fission and by budding.
Motile by means of a subpolar to lateral flagellum.
Electron micrographs reveal intracytoplasmatic membranes forming caps of flattened vesicles under the cell wall or membrane vesicles in the central region of the cell.
Colonies on agar plates are yellowish-white, 0.1 mm in diameter.
Best growth mixotrophically with nitrite, plus yeasts extract and peptone.
Slow growth under lithoautotrophie conditions. Nitrobacter Y is microaerophilic when grown lithoautotrophically preferring less than 6 % (v/v) oxygen in the atmosphere.
The pH for optimal growth between 7.5-8.0.
The DNA base composition is 61.4 mol % G + C.
DNA-DNA hybridization experiments revealed a moderate relationship to N. winogradskyi strain Engel (36 % using optimal reassociation conditions).
Isolated from soil of the Old Botanic Garden in Hamburg and from soil of Uxmal in Yucatan (Mexico).
